title: Counter Culture Coffee French Press
preparation_steps: Grind 31 grams of coffee to medium-coarse consistency
Pre-warm French Press with hot water
Add 31g ground coffee to French Press

brewing_steps.instruction: Start timer and pour 496g hot water in circular motion
brewing_steps.audio_script: Start the timer. Pour 496 grams of hot water in a steady circular motion. You have 25 seconds. Wetting the grounds evenly is crucial for a balanced extraction.

brewing_steps.instruction: Stir gently with wooden spoon to saturate all grounds
brewing_steps.audio_script: Use a wooden spoon to stir gently. You have 30 seconds. Ensure every bit of coffee is wet to prevent dry pockets that could lead to uneven flavor.

brewing_steps.instruction: Place lid on top, do not press plunger
brewing_steps.audio_script: Place the lid on top to keep the heat in, but do not press the plunger yet. Let it steep.
Now wait until the timer hits 6 minutes and 50 seconds total. This long steep extracts the deep, rich flavors characteristic of Counter Culture's method.

brewing_steps.instruction: Press plunger down slowly, pour within 20 seconds
brewing_steps.audio_script: Press the plunger down slowly and steadily. Aim to pour within 20 seconds. Enjoy the rich, full-bodied result.

what_to_expect.description: Counter Culture's French Press method emphasizes sustainability and quality. The wooden spoon prevents scratching, while the precise timing and medium-coarse grind create a balanced cup with excellent body and clarity.
what_to_expect.audio_script: Counter Culture emphasizes quality and sustainability. This method uses a wooden spoon and precise timing to create a balanced, full-bodied cup.

notes: Counter Culture's French Press method emphasizes sustainability and quality. The wooden spoon prevents scratching, while the precise timing and medium-coarse grind create a balanced cup with excellent body and clarity.
